criteria.armPosition: arms in fixed position of choice, no hands have contact to the pole
criteria.legPosition: inside leg is wrapped, outside leg is bent backwards
both legs are fully extended in straddle position with lower foot floor based and the arch of the upper foot is in contact with the pole
criteria.bodyPosition: torso is extended away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: inside arm holds outside foot, outside arm is in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: inside leg is wrapped, outside leg is bent backwards

criteria.armPosition: arms in fixed position of choice, no hands have contact to the pole
criteria.legPosition: inside leg is wrapped, outside leg is bent backwards
both legs are fully extended in straddle position with lower foot floor based and the arch of the upper foot is in contact with the pole
criteria.bodyPosition: torso is extended away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: inside hand grips pole, above the inside leg, outside arm is extended in a fixed position of choice
criteria.legPosition: frontal split position with both legs fully extended
criteria.bodyPosition: back arch, facing away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: inside arm has contact with the pole. No hands have contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in front split position and the front leg is parallel to the floor

pointsOfContact: ankles (not the arch of the foot)
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body must be at a 90° angle to the pole

pointsOfContact: top of foot of lower leg
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: inside hand grips pole, above the inside leg, outside arm is extended in a fixed position of choice
criteria.legPosition: frontal split position with both legs fully extended

criteria.armPosition: inside hand grips pole, above the inside leg, outside arm is extended and hand is holding the ankle/shin of the outside leg
criteria.legPosition: split position with inside leg fully extended, outside leg bent backwards

criteria.armPosition: grip of choice, arms are fully extended
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and closed

criteria.armPosition: no hands have contact with the pole, the same arm holds the ankle/shin of back leg and is fully extended, the opposite arm holds front leg
criteria.legPosition: split position with front leg fully extended, back leg bent

pointsOfContact: ankles (not the arch of the foot)
criteria.legPosition: both legs fully extended in straddle position
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body must be at a 90° angle to the pole

criteria.armPosition: only one hand has contact with the floor, the other is holding the ankle of the front leg, floor-based arm is fully extended
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in a vertical split position
criteria.bodyPosition: handstand position (hips above the head and above the shoulders in a straight line)

pointsOfContact: ankles (not the arch of the foot)
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body must be at 90° angle to the pole

criteria.armPosition: grip of choice, bottom arm is fully extended
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position
both legs are fully extended and closed
criteria.bodyPosition: back arch with hips and both legs parallel to the floor

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and parallel to the pole with feet above the head

criteria.armPosition: arms are fully extended, inside arm is in underarm grip, hands holding legs at the ankle/shin level
criteria.legPosition: both legs are bent and thighs are parallel to the floor or higher than hips
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body is upright, hips facing the floor

criteria.armPosition: inside hand grips pole above the inside leg, outside arm is extended and holding the ankle/shin of outside leg
criteria.legPosition: inside leg is fully extended, outside leg is bent backwards

criteria.armPosition: underarm or bicep of inside arm has contact with the pole. Inside arm is fully extended. Outside arm holding ankle of inside leg. No hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position
both legs are fully extended in frontal split position in contact with the pole
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body (torso and head) must be at a 90° angle to the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: underarm or bicep of inside arm has contact with the pole. Inside arm is fully extended. Outside arm holding ankle of inside leg. No hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in a frontal split position and parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: no hands have contact with the pole, arms are fully extended above the head in ring position and holding foot of outside leg
criteria.legPosition: inside leg is wrapped, both legs are bent

criteria.armPosition: basic or cup grip, holding the pole at the hips
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position
both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: arms are fully extended in split grip
criteria.legPosition: legs are in position of choice, on the same side of the pole as the body
criteria.bodyPosition: upright, upper body is in back arch

pointsOfContact: forearm and hand of lower arm
criteria.armPosition: top arm is in elbow grip, bottom arm is in forearm grip
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in a frontal split position
both legs are fully extended in split position of choice

criteria.armPosition: inside hand grips pole above the inside leg, outside arm is extended and holding the ankle/shin of the outside leg
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in a frontal split position

criteria.armPosition: no hands have contact with the pole, the same arm holds the ankle/shin of the back leg and is fully extended, the opposite arm holds front leg
criteria.legPosition: split position with front leg fully extended and the back leg bent

criteria.armPosition: underarm or bicep of inside arm has contact with the pole. Inside arm is fully extended and holding foot or ankle opposite leg. Outside arm holding ankle of inside leg. No hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: split position with inside leg fully extended and the back leg bent, the line of the legs is parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: arms are fully extended above the head in ring position and holding back leg
criteria.legPosition: split position with front leg gripping the pole at the knee, back leg is fully extended

criteria.armPosition: arms are fully extended, inside hand holding the inside leg at the shin level (between knee and ankle). Outside hand has contact with the floor.
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position. inside foot has contact with the floor

criteria.armPosition: only one hand has contact with the floor, the other is holding the ankle of the front leg, floor based arm is fully extended
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in a vertical split position
criteria.bodyPosition: handstand position (hips above the head and shoulders in a straight line)

criteria.armPosition: underarm. hands holding legs at the knee
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended with feet above the head
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body is upright, hips facing the floor

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body must be at a 90° angle to the pole and facing downwards

criteria.armPosition: inside arm is fully extended and holds the pole. Outside hand holds opposite ankle.
criteria.legPosition: in a split / oversplit; Front leg has no contact with the pole, and both legs are fully extended.
criteria.bodyPosition: upright, facing away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: arms can be bent, no hands have contact with the pole, hands are holding foot/ankle of back leg
criteria.legPosition: front leg is wrapped, back leg and foot must be stretched over the head or in a ring position
both legs are fully extended in split position and parallel to the pole

compulsories.name: Back split to pole ring position

criteria.legPosition: split position with front leg fully extended, back leg bent, foot must touch head

criteria.armPosition: both arms are bent and above the head, hands are clasped behind the head
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in a diagonal split

criteria.armPosition: no hands to have contact with the pole, the inside arm holds back leg at ankle/shin level and is fully extended. The outside arm holds front leg
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: underarm or bicep of inside arm has contact with the pole. Inside arm is fully extended. Outside arm holding ankle of inside leg. No hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs fully extended in split position and parallel to floor

criteria.armPosition: inside arm is fully extended and in contact with the pole, outside arm holds the pole behind the back
criteria.legPosition: both legs fully extended in front split position and parallel to floor

pointsOfContact: crook of elbow of one arm
criteria.legPosition: both legs extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: no hands have contact with the pole, elbow grip hand holding ankle of opposite leg, free arm is in fixed position of choice and has no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs fully extended in a frontal split position

pointsOfContact: hand and forearm of lower arm
criteria.armPosition: both arms are bent, outside arm is wrapped around the inside leg and holds the pole above the inside leg
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in a diagonal split position and at a 45° angle to the pole

pointsOfContact: lower arm/elbow. Upper arm has no contact with the pole
criteria.armPosition: both arms are bent, hands are clasped behind the inside leg and back
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in a horizontal split position

criteria.armPosition: underarm or bicep of inside arm has contact with the pole. Inside arm is fully extended and holding foot or ankle opposite leg. Outside hand is holding ankle/shin of inside leg. No hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: frontal split position with front leg fully extended and parallel to the floor, back leg is bent

criteria.armPosition: no hands have contact with the pole, arms are fully extended above the head in ring position and holding foot of outside leg
criteria.legPosition: both legs are bent, back foot is over the head

pointsOfContact: back of shoulder of inside arm
criteria.armPosition: outside arm in fixed position of choice. No hand contact with the pole. inside arm wraps around pole and leg
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position in alignment with the pole
split position with front leg bent, back leg fully extended

criteria.armPosition: arm holding upper leg is in an elbow grip, lower arm holds pole in forearm grip
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in a diagonal split

compulsories.name: Split grip leg through frontal split

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body (torso and head) is parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: both arms are fully extended, same hand holds same leg at shin level (between ankle and knee), no hands have contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: back leg is fully extended, other leg is in passé

pointsOfContact: ankles to the pole (not the arch of the foot)
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body (torso and head) must be at a 90° angle to the pole, chest facing upwards

criteria.armPosition: both arms are bent, hands are clasped behind the head
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in a diagonal split position

criteria.armPosition: arms are fully extended in wide basic grip. Upper hand grips the pole above the same leg at shin level. Lower hand grips the pole below the lower leg at thigh level.
criteria.legPosition: legs are fully extended

criteria.armPosition: arms are fully extended above the head in ring position and holding back leg
criteria.legPosition: split position with front leg gripping the pole at the knee, back leg fully extended

criteria.armPosition: inside arm is fully extended and in contact with the pole, outside arm holds the pole behind the back
criteria.legPosition: fang position with both legs bent back, toes touch the shoulder or the crown of head

criteria.armPosition: arms are fully extended, inside hand has contact with the pole, back of arm has contact with the inside leg. Outside hand has contact with the floor.
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: hand of bottom arm is in contact with the floor and arm is fully extended, top arm holds onto same leg
criteria.legPosition: both legs are extended in a split position, in a straight line, and only the foot of one leg in contact with the pole. Legs are parallel to the floor.
criteria.bodyPosition: torso is at a 90° to the pole

compulsories.name: Iguana elbow hold split no hands

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position and horizontal.
both legs are fully extended in split position, in a straight line
both legs are fully extended in split position. Leg with contact with the pole is parallel to the floor, no tolerance.
both legs are fully extended, split angle is at a 45° angle to the floor
criteria.bodyPosition: inverted, full body is at a 45° angle to the floor

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in a split position

criteria.armPosition: inside arm: underarm grip outside arm: basic or cup grip
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in a frontal split position, foot of outside leg should be holding the pole from behind. The front leg is the inside leg, the back leg is the outside leg.

criteria.armPosition: no hands have contact with the pole, arms are fully extended and hands are holding foot/ankle of back leg
criteria.legPosition: front leg is wrapped, back leg and foot must be stretched over the head or in a ring position
both legs are fully extended in split position and parallel to the pole
both legs are fully extended in split position
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body is in a back arch

compulsories.name: Back split overhead hold on pole

criteria.armPosition: both arms are fully extended and hands hold the pole above the head at ankle/calf height
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: inside arm is fully extended and in contact with the pole, outside arm holds the pole behind the back
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, open, and both legs parallel to the floor and each other
criteria.bodyPosition: inverted, hips parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: underarm grip (top arm) and elbow grip (bottom arm)
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended
criteria.bodyPosition: body is wrapped around the pole with a back arch position.

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and parallel to the floor in split position

criteria.armPosition: arms are fully extended, inside hand has contact with the pole, back of arm has contact with the inside leg. Outside hand has contact with the floor
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: both arms are fully extended, one hand is holding the pole, the other is fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: both arms are fully extended and hold the pole above the head at ankle height
criteria.legPosition: back leg is extended, lower leg is in passé

criteria.armPosition: grip of choice, both arms fully extended
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position, the line of the legs is parallel to the floor, the entire sole of the foot must be on the pole

pointsOfContact: forearm and hand of lower arm
criteria.armPosition: top arm is in elbow grip, bottom arm is in forearm grip
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in a frontal split position
both legs are fully extended on the same side as the body
criteria.bodyPosition: inverted, back bend, chest is facing downwards

pointsOfContact: back of thigh of inside leg
criteria.armPosition: underarm or bicep of inside arm has contact with the pole. Inside arm is fully extended. Outside arm holding ankle/calf of inside leg. No hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs fully extended in split position and parallel to floor
both legs are fully extended in split position. Back leg is parallel to the floor, no tolerance
criteria.bodyPosition: parallel to the floor, with 20° tolerance

pointsOfContact: top of foot of lower leg (not the arch of the foot)
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and parallel to the pole; upper leg has no contact with the pole
legs are in split position. Upper leg is bent in passé, bottom leg is fully extended.
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body is parallel to the floor, chest facing downwards.

criteria.armPosition: one hand has contact with the floor and the arm is fully extended, the top arm is bent and the hand has contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position, line of split is parallel to the floor. The upper leg should be supported on the upper part of the tricep/shoulder of the arm on the same side. There must be no leg contact with the pole.

criteria.armPosition: inside arm is fully extended and holding the same leg. Outside arm is bent and holding the pole at / above the head.
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and horizontal
criteria.bodyPosition: inverted, hips parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: inside arm is bent and forearm is in contact with the pole, outside arm holds the pole behind the back
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, closed, and both legs parallel to the floor and each other
criteria.bodyPosition: inverted, hips parallel to the floor

criteria.legPosition: legs are in frontal split position and fully extended
both legs are fully extended in split position
criteria.bodyPosition: inverted handstand, chest is facing downwards

criteria.armPosition: both arms are fully extended and open with no hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position with ankles to the pole (not the arch of the foot)
criteria.bodyPosition: torso is at a 90° angle to the pole

criteria.armPosition: both arms are fully extended and open with no hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position
criteria.bodyPosition: torso is at a 90° angle to the pole

pointsOfContact: underarm and hand of inside arm
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and parallel to the floor

pointsOfContact: underarm and hand of inside arm
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position, parallel to the floor
fully extended in split position, front leg (in contact with pole) parallel to the floor, no tolerance
criteria.bodyPosition: parallel to the floor, no tolerance

criteria.armPosition: arms are fully extended above the head, hands holding top foot
criteria.legPosition: both legs bent in attitude position
criteria.bodyPosition: upright, upper body is in back arch

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position.

pointsOfContact: inside of foot of inside leg
foot and shin of outside leg
criteria.armPosition: arms in position of choice with no contact to the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position.
criteria.bodyPosition: body must be at a 90° angle to the pole

criteria.armPosition: fixed position of choice, hands have no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are holding the pole
both legs are fully extended in straddle position

pointsOfContact: crook of elbow of inside arm
back of knee of inside leg
criteria.armPosition: inside arm is in elbow grip, outside arm in fixed position of choice
criteria.legPosition: inside leg is hooked, outside leg is fully extended, both legs are on the same side of the pole

pointsOfContact: crook of knee/calf of upper leg
shin and knee of lower leg
criteria.armPosition: one hand is holding the opposite leg (which is bent around the pole) at any point, other arm is in a fixed position of choice. No hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: one leg is bent around the pole and crossed in front of the other leg

pointsOfContact: crook of knee of opposite/outside leg
criteria.armPosition: Inside arm extended, pushing away from pole, outside arm in fixed position of choice
criteria.legPosition: front leg is around the pole in passé, back leg is fully extended behind
criteria.bodyPosition: inverted and at an angle away from the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and closed
tuck position
criteria.bodyPosition: body is at a 90° angle to the pole

pointsOfContact: inside leg knee and back of thigh
criteria.legPosition: fang position, inside leg hooked on pole
both legs are bent, one leg is hooked on pole

criteria.armPosition: both arms are in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: inside leg is hooked to the pole at the knee, outside leg is fully extended with the sole of the foot in contact with the pole

criteria.armPosition: inside arm is in elbow grip, outside arm is in a closed fixed position of choice. No hands have contact with the pole,
criteria.legPosition: both legs are in a fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole

pointsOfContact: back and side of thigh of inside leg.
criteria.legPosition: inside leg is hooked on pole, outside leg is extended in a fixed position of choice
criteria.bodyPosition: inverted, shoulders are pushed away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: Inside arm extended, pushing away from pole, outside arm in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: inside leg is hooked to the pole, outside leg is fully extended and parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: both arms are in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: one leg is fully extended, other leg is bent around the pole and crossed in front of the other leg

criteria.armPosition: arms in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: outside leg is bent and wrapped around the pole, inside leg is fully extended and parallel to the floor
both legs are fully extended in straddle position (in line with the hips or higher)

criteria.armPosition: both arms are fully extended, only one hand holds pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and closed
criteria.bodyPosition: hips and legs are parallel to the floor

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position
both legs are in attitude position
criteria.bodyPosition: full upper body (head to hips) at a 90° angle to the pole, with a tolerance of not more than 20°

criteria.armPosition: both arms are in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are bent, upper knee holds around the pole, lower knee pushes against the pole, feet may touch each other

criteria.armPosition: arms in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and closed with ankles crossed
legs are crossed around the pole: one leg grips the pole in the crook of the knee and while the foot of the other leg is in contact with the pole
criteria.bodyPosition: inverted, facing away from the pole

criteria.legPosition: straddle or pencil
criteria.bodyPosition: horizontal if ending in straddle, vertical and inverted if ending in pencil

criteria.legPosition: legs in position of choice, without contact with the pole
both legs are fully extended with inside arm holding the calf of the inside leg
knees on chest

criteria.armPosition: both arms are fully extended; one hand holds the opposite foot, while the other hand holds the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are bent, one is hooked around the pole in the back of the knee, the other is extended to the back, being held by the opposite hand
both legs are fully extended and closed
criteria.bodyPosition: chest and hips are facing away from the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body is parallel to the floor

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended
one leg grips the pole in the crook of the knee and along the back of the thigh, the other leg is crossed over the first leg
criteria.bodyPosition: inverted, facing away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: one hand is holding the pole; the other arm is fully extended.
criteria.legPosition: inside leg is in passé, outside leg is fully extended and parallel to the floor, both legs are on same side of the pole
criteria.bodyPosition: hips are parallel to the floor

criteria.legPosition: both legs are bent and thighs are in contact with the torso

criteria.armPosition: top hand is in cup grip
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position
criteria.bodyPosition: inverted. Heel of leg opposite to the top hand is on the pole, creating a twist in the hips

criteria.legPosition: upper leg is fully extended, lower leg is in passé
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body and leg are parallel to the floor

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in either straddle or pencil position

criteria.armPosition: arms in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole or the body
criteria.legPosition: outside leg is fully extended, inside leg is bent, position is held through pressure of the inside leg against the pole, and is not hooked at the knee
criteria.bodyPosition: angled, head downwards towards the floor

criteria.armPosition: one arm is extended with the hand holding the opposite leg (which is wrapped around the pole), other arm is in fixed position of choice
criteria.legPosition: one leg is fully extended, other leg is bent around the pole

criteria.armPosition: one arm is fully extended and holding the pole above the head, other arm is in elbow grip
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position
upper leg is fully extended and parallel to the floor
criteria.bodyPosition: entire body is parallel to the floor

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and closed
criteria.bodyPosition: body is at a 90° angle to the pole

criteria.armPosition: arms are bent and in forearm grip
criteria.legPosition: both legs are bent, ankle of opposite leg to upper arm is in contact with the pole, other leg is in fixed position of choice
criteria.bodyPosition: body is facing forwards, hips are away from the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and open
criteria.bodyPosition: back is to the pole and hip is on the elbow

criteria.armPosition: arms in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are bent and holding pole at the inner thighs and at least one foot, legs are not crossed, hips and tights are parallel to the floor. Feet are in contact with each other.
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body is in a back arched position

criteria.holdPosition: a minimum of 2 seconds in the final position (shouldermount plank with legs in straddle position)
criteria.legPosition: final position is both legs are fully extended in straddle position
criteria.bodyPosition: body is at a 90° angle to the pole in the final position, body completes a controlled lift or lower into the final position without momentum

criteria.legPosition: outside leg is fully extended, inside leg is bent and has contact with the pole
criteria.bodyPosition: body, inside arm and outside leg are parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: one arm is extended and holding the pole above the head, the other arm is in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, one foot has contact with the pole, opposite leg is extended away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: outside arm is fully extended in contact with the floor; inside arm is in flag grip
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor, hips and legs are closed

criteria.armPosition: grip of choice, excluding cup grip
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position, hips are naturally aligned to body position, legs are even
criteria.bodyPosition: full torso (head to hips) is at a 90° angle to the pole and facing in the same direction

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and open
criteria.bodyPosition: body is facing downwards and is at a 90° angle to the pole

criteria.armPosition: top hand in cup grip position
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position, parallel to the floor
criteria.startingPosition: with a minimum of one foot and one hand on the floor, deadlift (without any momentum) into a shoulder stand floor based straddle

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and open

compulsories.name: Back support plank outside leg passé

pointsOfContact: forearm has no contact with the pole.
criteria.legPosition: inside leg is fully extended, outside leg is in passé
criteria.bodyPosition: back and full length of the body is at a 90° angle to the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position
criteria.bodyPosition: legs, pelvis and body are on the same side of the pole without any contact to the pole or hands, upper body is at a 90° angle to the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position, hips are naturally aligned to body position, legs are even
criteria.bodyPosition: torso is at a 90° angle to the pole

criteria.armPosition: both arms are fully extended; top hand is in contact with the pole, bottom hand is in contact with the floor.
criteria.legPosition: legs are in a closed pike position and feet are above head, legs are parallel to the floor

compulsories.name: Iguana elbow hold straddle no hands

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position, and on same side of the pole as the body
upper leg is fully extended, lower leg is in passé
criteria.bodyPosition: full upper body (head to hips) and upper leg at a 90° angle to the pole in straight line and facing in the same direction, with a tolerance of not more of 20°

criteria.armPosition: Inside arm in underarm grip, outside arm in flag grip
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and open
criteria.bodyPosition: body and both legs facing downwards at 90° to the pole

criteria.armPosition: arms in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended
criteria.bodyPosition: torso is at 90° to the pole

criteria.armPosition: top arm is bent and in contact with the pole, bottom arm is fully extended and in contact with the floor
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position (with no contact to the pole or floor). The upper leg should be supported on the upper part of the tricep/shoulder of the arm on the same side. There must be no leg contact with the pole.
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body is parallel to the floor

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position, hips are naturally aligned to body position, legs are even
criteria.bodyPosition: full torso (head to hips) is at a 90° angle to the pole and facing in the same direction

criteria.armPosition: both arms are fully extended; top arm is in contact with the pole, bottom arm is in contact with the floor.
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and open in a straddle position
criteria.bodyPosition: body angle and lower leg are parallel to the floor

criteria.holdPosition: walk a minimum of 2 seconds, final position - Iguana horizontal – must be held for a brief moment
criteria.legPosition: walking motion
criteria.bodyPosition: starting position is inverted, in final position the full length of the body is parallel to the floor, including legs as well
criteria.startingPosition: From an inverted vertical position perform a slow and steady descent to a 90° angle to the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and open
criteria.bodyPosition: body is facing downwards at 90° to the pole

compulsories.name: One shoulder side plank legs open

criteria.armPosition: inside arm is fully extended and in contact with the pole, outside arm is bent with the hand holding the pole behind the head
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor and open
criteria.bodyPosition: body is at 90° to the pole

criteria.legPosition: one leg is fully extended, other leg is in passé at a 90° to the pole
criteria.bodyPosition: body and extended leg are at 90° to the pole
criteria.startingPosition: from an aerial shoulder mount, deadlift or lower into plank

compulsories.name: Split grip reverse plank legs open

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and open
criteria.bodyPosition: body is facing downwards at 90° to the pole

compulsories.name: Split grip side plank legs open

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and open
criteria.bodyPosition: body is facing downwards at 90° to the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: body and both legs are facing downwards at 90° to the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor, hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: body is at 90° to the pole

pointsOfContact: forearm has no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor, hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: body is at 90° to the pole

criteria.armPosition: top hand is in cup grip
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: body is at 90° to the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor, hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: body is at 90° to the pole

criteria.armPosition: top arm is in contact with the pole, bottom arm is in contact with the floor.
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and closed
criteria.startingPosition: in a starting fixed position of choice with one hand on the pole and one hand on the floor, perform a complete 360° rotation of the body to return to the starting position

criteria.armPosition: both arms are fully extended; top arm is in contact with the pole, bottom arm is in contact with the floor
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor, hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: entire body is at 90° to the pole

criteria.holdPosition: a minimum of 2 seconds in the final position
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor, hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: entire body is at 90° to the pole
criteria.startingPosition: from an aerial position, deadlift or lower to a 90° horizontal angle to the pole, parallel to the floor

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor, hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: entire body (from head to feet) is at 90° to the pole and facing in the same direction

compulsories.name: One shoulder side plank legs closed

criteria.armPosition: inside arm is fully extended and in contact with the pole, outside arm is bent with the hand holding the pole behind the head
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor, hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: entire body is at 90° to the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor, hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: back and legs are at 90° to the pole
criteria.startingPosition: from an aerial shoulder mount position, deadlift or lower into plank

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor, hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: entire body is at 90° to the pole

pointsOfContact: lower part of the glutes have contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor, hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: entire body (head to feet) is straight and at 90° to the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor, hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: entire body is facing downwards, at 90° to the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor, hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: entire body is facing downwards at 90° to the pole

criteria.legPosition: starting in an upright position of choice, extended away from the pole. Perform a complete 360° rotation of the entire body (legs, hips and torso) above the head, to return to the starting position, and repeat.
diamond
both legs are bent and are in contact with the pole at the ankles
diamond

compulsories.name: Attitude spin outside heel on pole

criteria.legPosition: legs are in attitude position, parallel to floor
chair position at 90° angle
legs are in attitude position, parallel to floor
inside leg is bent in front of pole, outside leg is fully extended behind pole
legs are in attitude position, parallel to floor

criteria.holdPosition: a minimum of 360° rotation in the final position
criteria.legPosition: legs are in attitude in the final position
criteria.bodyPosition: upright at an angle away from the pole

criteria.legPosition: diamond
both legs fully extended and closed in pike position, parallel to floor
tucked around the pole
both legs are in attitude
both legs are fully extended in straddle position
criteria.bodyPosition: upper body is parallel to the floor

criteria.legPosition: both legs finish in a fully extended pencil position
criteria.bodyPosition: extended in a pencil position at an angle away from the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position above the hips
both legs are fully extended in straddle position, then pencil

compulsories.name: Spinning into a shoulder mount straddle

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position, parallel to floor
both legs fully extended and closed
criteria.bodyPosition: extended in a pencil position at an angle away from the pole

criteria.holdPosition: a minimum of 360° rotation, where the rotation must be maintained until the butterfly extension is fully extended
criteria.legPosition: tuck position followed by split position
criteria.bodyPosition: criteria of Cradle spin and Butterfly extension apply (refer to ST12 and S18)

criteria.legPosition: legs in fixed position of choice
criteria.bodyPosition: upright at an angle away from the pole

criteria.holdPosition: a minimum of 360° rotation, where the handspring should still spin
criteria.legPosition: legs finish in a fixed position of choice
criteria.bodyPosition: body moves into inverted position after handspring

criteria.legPosition: legs in fixed position of choice
criteria.bodyPosition: upright at an angle away from the pole

criteria.holdPosition: a minimum of 720° rotation, where the handspring should still spin
criteria.legPosition: fixed leg position of choice

criteria.holdPosition: a minimum of 360° rotation, where the handspring should still spin
criteria.legPosition: legs finish in a fixed leg position of choice
criteria.bodyPosition: back is to the pole for the reverse spin, body moves into inverted position after handspring without changing direction (i.e. turning back), hips must face upwards.

criteria.holdPosition: a minimum of 720° rotation, where the handspring should still spin
criteria.armPosition: cup grip –in pencil with both hands, only with top hand in inverted position
criteria.legPosition: spin begins in pencil (see ST19 for minimum criteria), and finishes in a fixed leg position of choice
criteria.bodyPosition: pencil position for spin, inverted for final position

criteria.holdPosition: a minimum of 720° rotation, where the handspring should still spin
criteria.legPosition: fixed leg position of choice
thighs are parallel to the floor and legs closed

pointsOfContact: crook of knee of outside leg
criteria.armPosition: Inside hand holds pole from behind outside knee, outside hand holds inside foot
criteria.legPosition: outside leg grips the pole in the crook of the knee, inside leg is bent

pointsOfContact: thigh and crook of knee of other leg
criteria.armPosition: arms are in fixed position of choice, no hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: one leg is fully extended alongside the pole, other leg is bent around the pole
criteria.bodyPosition: upright, head is on same side of the pole as the foot of bent leg

criteria.armPosition: both hands hold the legs at ankle/shin
criteria.legPosition: fang position
criteria.startingPosition: with a minimum of one foot on the floor

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and closed in pencil position

criteria.armPosition: inner arm is wrapped around the pole behind the body, outer arm is bent holding the pole at the level of the head or higher
criteria.legPosition: seated position with legs bent and tucked to one side of the pole
diamond
both legs are fully extended in straddle position, parallel to floor
tuck, with pole between inner thighs in a seated position
criteria.bodyPosition: body is at a 90° angle to the pole

criteria.legPosition: one leg is fully extended along the pole, the other knee is bent

pointsOfContact: crook of elbow of inside arm
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended
in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
outside leg is fully extended, inside leg wraps the pole at knee
tucked
criteria.bodyPosition: body is at a 90° angle to the pole

compulsories.name: Inverted bodyspiral outside leg stretched behind pole.

criteria.armPosition: inside arm is holding pole, elbow of outside arm is in contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: inside leg is in passé in front of pole, outside leg is fully extended behind the pole

criteria.armPosition: arms wrap around the legs with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: inverted tuck
criteria.bodyPosition: inverted with the back facing downwards

criteria.armPosition: both hands hold the legs at ankle/shin level
criteria.legPosition: fang position

compulsories.name: Cradle spin pike no hands legs fully stretched

criteria.armPosition: both arms are wrapped around the legs with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and closed in pike position
criteria.bodyPosition: wrapped around the pole and parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: inside arm is fully extended and holding pole, outside arm is in a fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and closed in a pike position
both legs in attitude, parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: both arms are fully extended, outside arm is in a fixed position of choice, inside arm is in underarm grip
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in a straddle position
both legs are bent in fang position
both legs are fully extended and closed in pencil position
criteria.bodyPosition: upright and parallel to the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position, parallel to the floor or higher than hips

criteria.armPosition: same arm as shoulder which is on pole is extended, the other arm is in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, one foot has contact with the pole, opposite leg is extended away from the pole

pointsOfContact: crook of the knee of the inside leg
back of shoulder of inside arm
criteria.armPosition: back of the shoulder of inside arm on pole. Outside arm in position of choice with no contact with the pole.
criteria.legPosition: inside leg grips pole in the crook of the knee, outside leg in position of choice
front leg is bent, back leg is fully extended
criteria.bodyPosition: upright at an angle away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: upper arm is fully extended and holds the pole, lower arm wraps around the pole.
criteria.legPosition: lower foot steps on lower hand, legs are in a split position of choice
criteria.bodyPosition: torso facing away from the pole

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position, parallel to the pole
both legs are fully extended in a closed pike position or crossed
criteria.bodyPosition: body and legs are in front of the pole at a 90° angle to the pole

criteria.armPosition: arms have no contact with the body or the pole
criteria.legPosition: tucked (legs closed)
criteria.bodyPosition: body is at a 90° angle to the pole

criteria.armPosition: both hands are in a cup grip position
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in pencil position
criteria.bodyPosition: upright at an angle away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: both arms are fully extended, with inside arm holding the pole, and the outside arm holding the outside leg
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: both arms are fully extended back, and have no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended
criteria.bodyPosition: upright, upper body in back arch

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in straddle position with no contact with the pole
both legs are fully extended in split position
both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: inside arm is extended and in contact with the pole, outside arm in a fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended and closed in pencil position
criteria.bodyPosition: upright, away from the pole, parallel to the pole

criteria.armPosition: inside arm fully extended and in contact with the pole, outside arm in a fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: fully extended and closed
both legs are fully extended and closed, parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: no hand contact, both arms are fully extended
criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor, hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: entire body (head to feet) is straight and at 90° to the pole, with a tolerance of not more of 20°

criteria.legPosition: both legs are fully extended in split position, parallel to the pole
criteria.bodyPosition: upright, away from the pole, parallel to the pole

criteria.legPosition: starting in an upright position, legs and hips make a circular rotation (fan kick/flair) passing through an inverted position with the hips above the head, ending in pike position (jack knife) over the head for 2 times

criteria.armPosition: inside arm is fully extended, and the triceps has contact with the pole; outside arm is in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole.
criteria.legPosition: fully extended and closed

pointsOfContact: crook of the knee of the bottom leg
criteria.legPosition: lower leg must be extended, with shin of the top leg is in contact with the pole
criteria.bodyPosition: upright, facing away from the pole
